description: It's a group activity of 2 members in each team. First round will be written MCQ round. Out of this 6-8 teams will be selected and will be competing together. They have to go through a rapid fire round consisting of different categories of management related questions. Out of this 1st and 2nd winner will be declared.
rules: There will be only 2 members in each team.
From one college only 3 teams will be allowed to participate.
There will be 2 rounds in this quiz competition and in case of tie there will be a round 3 which will be a rapid fire question
In first round, 20 MCQ questions will be provided on a sheet and the evaluation will be done accordingly.
6 teams will be selected after this round.
In second round, questions will be shared on the board through ppt and the team who will answer first will gain points.
Questions will be related to business world.

description: It’s a group activity where each group would be given Rs. 100 as startup capital.A group may consist of 3-4 members. They would have to purchase some raw material, create something out of it and sell it to the people and report back after 3 hours to judges with a video showing the selling. The winners would be decided on the basis of the profit, method of selling etc. Participants would present the strategies used for selling and profits earned. Students from Professional courses like MBA, B.Tech, BBA, BCA and MIB will be allowed to participate. Team members can be from different graduate or undergraduate programs on the same team. Eatable items are not allowed to sale . Showing false sales or indulging in any kind of unfair practice will lead to disqualification from the event.
rules:
It is a group activity where each group would use their Rs. 100 as startup capital
A group may consist of 3-4 members.
They would have to purchase some raw material, create something out of it and sell it to the people and report back after 3 hours to judges with a video showing the selling.
The winners would be decided on the basis of the profit, method of selling etc.
Participants would present the strategies used for selling and profits earned.
Team members can be from different graduate or undergraduate programs on the same team.
Showing false sales or indulging in any kind of unfair practice will lead to disqualification from the event.

eventName: Ad Zap - The Ad Mad Show
description: Ad Zap is an exhilarating and cutting-edge event designed to bring together advertising professionals, marketers, entrepreneurs, and creative enthusiasts for an immersive experience in the world of advertising. This event aims to explore the latest trends, strategies, and innovations in the advertising industry while providing a platform for networking and collaboration.
rules: 1. This event is not an individual event; each team should comprise of a minimum of 4 members and a maximum of 5 members.
2. The advertisement may be in english or Hindi language (avoid usage of both languages at same time).

3. The first round will consist of ad jingles and taglines of the product that you have created or chosen. 
 Time limit: 5 minutes.
4. Selected teams will be able to participate in the next round.

5. In Second round, teams will present their Ads. (Acting on stage). 
Time limit: 5 - 8 minutes.
6. The criterion for assessment includes content, spontaneity and adherence to the topic, coordination, appeal of the advertisement, humor and performance on the stage.
7. There should be no exposure to biasness against any caste or community or religion through your performance.
8. Use of vulgar expression and language will lead to disqualification of the team.

description: It’s a team activity. Participants are supposed to transform their waste products into some useful product with the existing material. 1hour and 30 minutes would be provided to complete the activity. A team of 3-4 students are invited to participate.Teams need to bring their own Waste Material / products (min 3 max 10). Winner will be awarded on the basis of the judgment criteria. In case of any dispute, jury members will be authorized to take the final decision. Stationary will be provided to every team.
rules: The decision of the judge will be considered final and abiding.
Maximum 2-4 members in each team.
Participants will be given 1 hour and 30 minutes to make the creative model and 2 minutes for explanation.
Waste material can be anything like tetra Pack, bottles, newspapers, old utensils, jute materials or second hand items.
The model will be rejected if not found to be a waste product or second hand item.
No ready or semi-finished model or matter would be accepted.
Participants will be judged on creativity, utilisation of resources, artistic composition and design, eco-friendly rating, utility of the product and overall presentation.

description:
Each team should comprise a maximum of 4 participants. A member can be part of only one team. No change in the team structure is permitted after the team has registered. The event is open for students of ALL COURSES. Participants must adhere to the timelines. Incomplete entries or entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified.
All teams are advised to share their presentations before 8 February 2024 on businessplan.aaghaaz2024@gmail.com
rules:
Each team should comprise a maximum of 4 participants and need to share their presenatation latest by 8 February
A member can be part of one team only.
The event is open for students of all courses.

Incomplete entries or the entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified
All teams are required to share their presentation to businessplan.aaghaaz2024@gmail.com 

Each team will be given 10 minutes for presentation plus 2 minutes for Q&A

Any number of business plans, from an institution is allowed, provided that teams have no comman members

description: Each team should comprise a maximum of three students. A member can be part of only one team. No change in the team structure is permitted after the team has registered, The event is open for students of any UG/PG Course, Participants must adhere to the timelines. Incomplete entries or entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified.Teams would cover Aaghaaz 2023 in their videos, edit and present the videos in form of movie. The short film can include text, images, photos, videos or any combination of these elements on Aaghaaz. The Video duration must be a minimum of 5 min and a maximum of 10 min. The decision of the organizers of the event and the panel of judges will be final and will be binding on all the participants. The video must not contain any nudity , otherwise offensive or inappropriate content.
rules:
Entries are invited for solo as well as team (2 members maximum).
The theme of the Video making competition is Glimpses of Aaghaaz- 2024@IMSEC.
Every video must use the hashtag while uploading their video on the given link. #SMARTCapture 
The video should revolve around the theme subject and the Video length would be Max (1-2minutes).
Contents should not be disrespectful and abusive. The use of slang language must be avoided.
The video can be edited using music and captions and should be one's own creation. No plagiarism is accepted.
The quality of the video should be of minimum 720p.(1080p is accepted but while online streaming, it is difficult to be visible to all video participants,
analysing an optimum internet speed, so it is your own choice if you wish to make your video in 1080p). 
The Criteria for evaluation will be Creativity, Content, editing skills and Concept

description:
It a web-design contest, in which team of two members will design webpage on the theme given on spot. 
Three hyperlink should be active to next page.
rules: Team of Only 2 Members Allowed
Only Notepad/VsCode is allowed.
Only HTML,CSS & JS are allowed
Minimum of 3 hyperlinks to be added
A webpage has to be designed on the theme given on the spot
Any assets would be given on the spot.
Teams should only include participants who are not organizers, volunteers, judges, sponsors, or in any other privileged position
Working on a project before the event and open-sourcing it for the sole purpose of using the code during the event is against the rules.

description: It is coding contest, in which participant will write code of the given problem, without having code visible. Monitor will be in off mode. There will be three rounds of 15 minutes each. Participant can write the code in either C/C++/JAVA. Two awards will be given. Participants must adhere to the timelines. Incomplete entries or entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified. Duration of the event will 2hours. Students from BTech, MCA, BCA can participate.
rules:
Each participant has to write the code to given problem, with MONITOR OFF.
Participants whose code gets execute will be given higher preference.
Any attempt to turn the monitor on will result in disqualification of the participant.
Programming language used : C / C++ / Java.
The second preference will be given to code with least number of error.
In case of tie in number of errors, TIME of SUBMISSION will be considered.

description: Research paper presentation will be held on idea on recent IT topics. Team of one or two members can present their views and ideas on their topic through ppt presentation. Duration of each presentation will be maximum 15 minutes including Q/A sessions. Two awards will be given. Participants must adhere to the timelines. Incomplete entries or entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified. Duration of the event will 2hours. Students from BTech, MCA, BCA can participate.
rules: Research paper presentation will be held on recent IT topics.
Team of one or two members can present their views and ideas on their topic through ppt presentation.Team can have participants from different colleges.
Registration will not be accepted unless submitted via the official contest google form.
Duration of each presentation wil be maxiamum 15 minutes including Q/A sessions.Two awards will be given.
Participants must adhere to the timelines. Incomplete entries or entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified.
Duration of the event will be 2 hours
Students from any UG/PG Courses can participate.
Entries will be judged by the judges. All decisions are final. The judges pannel reserves the right to disqualify any entry that is deemed inappropriate or does not conform to stated contest rules.
Paper presentation contest in hybrid mode. Student can also participate online.

description: Students will play BGMI. Students must carry mobile phones with games installed their mobile phone. Mobile data is to be used for internet connection. Duration of this event will be 2 hours . Two awards will be given. Participants must adhere to the timelines. Incomplete entries or entries that do not comply with the above specifications will be automatically disqualified. Duration of the event will 2hours. Students from BTech, MCA, BCA can participate.
rules: It is a 4-Man Squad Event
Registration would be done as a Solo
A squad will be made on spot to make every team a 4 man.
The Game must be Pre-Installed on the Device
The Organizers won't be responsible for any technical failure on the participant's side
Participants must have Mobile Data
Any Misbehavior, breaking of rules, cheating or hacking will lead to disqualification

description: It is a photography and videography contest through mobile phones, where participants can capture photos and shoot videos of our campus and post them on their social media platforms. Participants are required to encourage their friends to like and share these entries. Two awards will be given, and the event will last for two hours. Participants must strictly adhere to the timelines. Incomplete or entries that do not comply with the specified guidelines will be automatically disqualified. The event is open to students from BTech, MCA, BCA, and BBA.
rules:
Individual registrations need to be sent.
An individual will be given a maximum time of 2 hours in the contest.
Photos/videos can be clicked using DSLRs, Digital Cameras and Smartphones.
Post processing of any type isn’t allowed. In-built Camera presets and filters can be used. Only basic editing (Lighting fixes, changes to hue/saturation) is allowed. Morphing, stitching pictures/videos or using multiple pictures to create one image in any way or any changes to the original Photograph is unacceptable and will render the photograph/video ineligible for a prize.
The photograph/video, in its entirety, must be a single work of original material taken by the Contest entrant.
Clearly mention your name, email id, name of your college/department and contact number.
Registration will not be accepted unless submitted via the official contest google form.
Entries will be judged by the following criteria:- a) Contestants have to post their work on Instagram with hashtags. b) For each like and comment you will get 1-1 points and for share will score 2. c) Maximum time limit of video can be 30 seconds only, exceeding the time limit can lead to penalty.
Photos and videos will be judged seperately. All decisions are final.
The judges panel reserves the right to disqualify any entry that is deemed inappropriate or does not conform to seated contest rules.
By entering the contest, entrants agree that photos/video submitted can be used by the institute for advertising purposes.

description:
Embark on a thrilling journey of strategic prowess at our Best Manager competition! Unleash your leadership skills, navigate challenges, and vie for victory in this intense battle of management acume exhibit resilience, and bask ready? Sharpen your wit, In the glory of managerial excellence. Are you

BEST MANAGER PARTICIPANTS EXCLUSIVE

COLLEGE ID MANDATORY

BRING BEST OUT OF BEST

JUDGES DECISION WILL BE FINAL
rules:
Best Manager is an individual event. 


Participant of Best Manager competition is not allowed to participate in any other game .
There can be any number of participants from a college. 

All participants should mandatorily bring their college ID card. 
Participants are expected to bring their own mobile phones, laptops, pen drive, etc. 

Rules will be specific for each rounds. 
Participants will be disqualified on the spot if they fail to adhere to the rules. 
It is the responsibility of the participants to clear the doubts before the game commences.
 Decision of the judges will be final.
